data.title: Any plan to support vulkan?
data.body:
Hi all,
vulkan is becoming more and more popular. I think we'd better have a plan to support it.

Thanks,
Yingjun

data.title: Text element GetCharPosition/Size return wrong data on first character of a new line
data.body:
The issue presents itself only if the new line is induced by the text wrapping without "/n"
The data returned is the end of the previous line for GetCharPosition and IntVector2::ZERO for GetCharSize

Adding 
`if(lastFilled>printToText_[i])
            lastFilled=printToText_[i];`
in Text.cpp in `void Text::UpdateCharLocations()`
before
`// Fill gaps in case characters were skipped from printing`
       `for (unsigned j = lastFilled; j <= printToText_[i]; ++j)`
            `charLocations_[j] = loc;`
       `lastFilled = printToText_[i] + 1;`
should solve the problem

data.title: GCC c++14 key generation
data.body: Hi, if I understand correctly Urho has option C++11 to enable support of c++11, but I couldn't find any option for c++14 generation. If I modify my project's CMakeLists.txt adding c++14 to CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS it won't work because CMake generator creates flags with c++11 which interrupts c++14 anyway. Is there a correct option to generate with CMake both on Windows and Linux with c++14?

data.title: How does WorkQueue work?
data.body:
Look at work with **queue_** list.
It is _optionally_ populated in **AddWorkItem** and nowhere else.
So added items could stay outside queue forewer.
E.g. if I add item with priority 2 and then with priority 1, the last item won't get into queue.
I suppose that items should always be put into queue, am I right?

**Upd:** Actually, it will work because Urho always use 0xffffffff priority

data.title: URHO3D_MACOSX_BUNDLE option does not find Resource folders
data.body:
Building the samples with URHO3D_MACOSX_BUNDLE=1 and using Xcode as the generator will create bunch of apps packaged up with Plists, icons, and the Data/CoreData folders. However, on start, the app cannot find the Data/CoreData folders. 

I've tried quite a few different combos of resource locations and custom resource prefixes. The only thing that kind of works is to provide the full, absolute, path to the resources. This is of course not really a solution, since it assumes a single location for the app.

What I really don't understand is if my app contents looks like this:

-App
--Contents
---MacOS
----AppExecutable
---Resources
----CoreData
----Data

and I provide the custom Resource prefix "../Resources", why the app can't find the Resources. I suspect something is up with FileSystem::CurrentDir() but I don't know.

data.title: Recognize the DirectX that comes with MinGW-w64
data.body:
I've noticed that any recent version of the MinGW-w64 compiler comes with most of the necessary libraries and headers of DirectX. Actually, it comes with a whole lot of other built-in libraries. However the build system does not recognize these headers and libraries. Could it be possible to use these instead of having to install the SDK provided by Mirosoft? I'm mostly interested in DirectX 9.

I've compiled DirectX applications in the past without having to install the SDK. In fact, I didn't even had to explicitly link to the libraries. I'm guessing that MinGW noticed I was including the headers and deduced the libraries automatically.

![Screen](https://s13.postimg.org/nm02i5n07/Untitled.png)

MinGW-w64 6.2.0 x64

EDIT: So far I could get it to work by explicitly setting these variables to something like:

```
DIRECTX_INC_SEARCH_PATHS _:\MinGW\620_64\x86_64-w64-mingw32\include
DIRECTX_LIB_SEARCH_PATHS _:\MinGW\620_64\x86_64-w64-mingw32\lib
```

data.title: Utility functions
data.body:
First of all - im sorry, i know it should be one PR per feature, but i did not want to flood project with 5-line PRs. If anything is not agreeable i will overwrite these commits based on discussion for a clean merge in the end.

For my own needs i added bunch of utility functions that ease life. 

`UIElement::FindChildrenWithTag()` and `Node::GetChildren*()` functions that return vectors with results. This is very convenient as it allows to use said functions in modern c++ loops like `for (auto child : node->GetChildren())`. It also is not a performance issue if modern compiler is used since compilers rewrite calls that return objects by value to calls that receive variable by reference for storing return value.

`IntVector2::Length()` - self explanatory.

`Node::SetTransform(const Matrix3x4& matrix)` - a convenience function expanding to `SetTransform(matrix.Translation(), matrix.Rotation(), matrix.Scale());`.

~~Log writing functions `Log::Write(int level, const char* messageFormat, ...)` and `Log::WriteArgs(int level, const char* messageFormat, va_list ap)` - write formatted log messages using `String::AppendWithFormatArgs()`. Now debug message logging is way more convenient.~~

data.title: Mouse visible by default
data.body:
~~Currently mouse is hidden by default. We can make mouse visible in `Application::Start()` but at this point engine has already centered mouse cursor. If game is started in a windowed mode it artificially changes mouse cursor position to the center of a window which is undesired behavior. With mouse visible by default this does not happen. Games that do not require mouse to be visible or need mouse centered can explicitly do this in `Application::Start()` method.~~

New engine parameters:
- MouseVisible: controls initial OS cursor visibility.
- MousseMode: controls initial OS cursor mode.

Use of engine parameters allows to avoid undesired mouse cursor centering in windowed applications that require visible cursor.

Notable changes:
- `Engine::HasParameter()` is no longer static.
- `Engine::GetParameter()` is no longer static.

These methods were used only in `Engine::Initialize()` method so impact is minimal.

Setting mouse parameters before window initialization did nothing and setting them after window initialization centered mouse anyway. The only sensible way was to set these parameters upon `Input` subsystem initialization when window is available. This conveniently happens on first `E_SCREENMODE` event. I had to store parsed parameters in `Engine::engineParameters_` member to allow `Input` subsystem to access parameters at correct time.

data.title: Mouse is still locked after engine terminates
data.body:
I'm having this strange issue that only occurs when using **fullscreen** mode.

When the engine exits and closes, my mouse pointer is still confined to a 1024x768 box (which is the fullscreen resolution), even though my monitor is 1366x768.

The only way to fix it is to restart X.

This issue occurs on the current HEAD of master (8d76730f5) and I'm running linux gentoo-4.4.21 x86_64

data.title: UIElement::CreateChildXML() returns child instead of bool
data.body:
As discussed on the forum: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic2437.html
- The return value of LoadChildXML() is now a pointer to the new child (or NULL if it fails)
- The child is destroyed if loading fails, instead of keeping an empty child around

data.title: Bucket of minor changes
data.body:
Since I have push access to Urho repo and bucket of minor changes, I'd like to confirm first that they are acceptable.
- Some templatized signature for all `SomeType ToSomeType(String)` functions. I am unsure about its name. `T To<>(String)` is too common word, but I don't have other ideas. **Let's discuss.**
- Image::SaveDDS limited to uncompressed 4-component mip-mapped image wihtout layers
- Image::Save save to JPG, BMP, PNG, TGA or DDS depending on file extension
- UniquePtr as smart wrapper for dumb new/delete ops
- MakeUnique and MakeShared with variadic implementation on C++11 and 0-arg + 1-arg hardcoded signatures on C++98
- Override begin() and end() for Pair to allow using Pair as range in for loops (C++11)
- UpperBound and LowerBound templates in Vector.h
- UnLerp and UnLerpClamped as opposite of Lerp operation
- Pow, Sqrt, Floor, Round, Ceil simple wrappers to bring some naming consistency with other functions and AS
- VectorFloor, VectorCeil, VectorRound, VectorMax, VectorMin as per-component vector wrappers for scalar functions
- Stable 'seed-less' random ops like uint->unit, float->float, vec2->float and vec3->float.
  I am unsure about implementation, but there are few variants.

data.title: LoadChildXML return type changed
data.body:
As discussed on the forum: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic2437.html
- The return value of LoadChildXML() is now a pointer to the new child (or NULL if it fails)
- The child is destroyed if loading fails, instead of keeping an empty child around

data.title: MRT not supported on iPad mini retina
data.body:
iPad mini retina already supports OpenGL ES 3.0, but shaders are limited up to OpenGL ES 2.0.
All shaders which use MRT will refuse to compile.

data.title: ERROR: Could not initialize OpenGL / GLES library
data.body:
Hi all,
I attempted several times to install Urho3D on RPi, which failed.
Finally, I reinstalled Raspbian Jessie OS.
Then reinstalled Urho3D with the following method(with RPi's experimental OpenGL disabled, and GPU=768 MB.) :

```
    sudo apt-get update
    sudo apt-get install build-essential
    sudo apt-get install freeglut3 freeglut3-dev
    sudo apt-get install unixodbc-dev

    sudo apt-get install libevdev2

    sudo apt-get install libasound2-dev
    sudo apt-get install libaudio-dev
    sudo apt-get install libesd0-dev
    sudo apt-get install libpulse-dev
    sudo apt-get install libroar-dev
    sudo apt-get install libreadline6-dev

    sudo apt-get install git cmake make

    sudo git clone https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D
    cd Urho3D
    sudo ./cmake_rpi.sh /home/pi/Urho3D
    sudo make
```

Now after installation, when I run ./Urho3DPlayer , it gives the following error:

```
    [Thu Oct 13 10:56:17 2016] INFO: Opened log file /home/pi/.local/share/urho3d/logs/NinjaSnowWar.as.log
    [Thu Oct 13 10:56:17 2016] INFO: Created 3 worker threads
    [Thu Oct 13 10:56:17 2016] INFO: Added resource path /home/pi/Urho3D/bin/Data/
    [Thu Oct 13 10:56:17 2016] INFO: Added resource path /home/pi/Urho3D/bin/CoreData/
    [Thu Oct 13 10:56:17 2016] INFO: Added resource path /home/pi/Urho3D/bin/Autoload/LargeData/
    [Thu Oct 13 10:56:17 2016] ERROR: Could not create window, root cause: 'Could not initialize OpenGL / GLES library'
```

What is the problem !!?
How can I successfully get Urho3D to work on RPi !!!?!?!?!?

data.title: Fixed compile error about narrowing conversions.
data.body:
See #1637.

The compile error was apparently being caused by cases where `BT_INFINITY` was defined as a double, and the `btAssign128` macro was being used, causing a narrowing conversion error. This commit fixes it by casting the values passed to `btAssign128` to floats.

data.title: Fixed an issue for SQLite queries where String::Trimmed was being corrupted
data.body: This should allow sql queries to run properly when DbConnection::Execute is provided a string. This fix is only for SQLite queries.

data.title: Narrowing conversion error trying to compile Urho3D under C++11.
data.body:
I'm encountering an error with narrowing conversions, while trying to compile Urho3D under C++11 (with `URHO3D_C++11` build option). The error occurs in the Bullet code:

```
C:\Projects\Game Development\Engines\Urho3D\Source\ThirdParty\Bullet\src\LinearMath\btScalar.h:339:54: error: narrowing conversion of '+Inf' from 'double' to 'float' inside { }
 #define btAssign128(r0,r1,r2,r3) (__m128){r0,r1,r2,r3}
                                                      ^
C:\Projects\Game Development\Engines\Urho3D\Source\ThirdParty\Bullet\src\LinearMath\btVector3.cpp:442:21: note: in expansion of macro 'btAssign128'
     float4 dotmin = btAssign128( BT_INFINITY,  BT_INFINITY,  BT_INFINITY,  BT_INFINITY );
                     ^
```

That's the basic error (it is repeated a couple of times, in different places, sometimes with `-Inf` instead of `+Inf`).

My compiler is TDM-GCC 5.1.0, under Windows. This error cropped up this time with commit `9b78bbacb60ea3a37faa3001ee60cd87c3ec31f1`, but it has occurred to me earlier as well (cannot recall the commit hash).

I managed to work around it by changing the Bullet source code which throws the error (mentioned above in the log):

```
 #define btAssign128(r0,r1,r2,r3) (__m128){r0,r1,r2,r3}
```

to:

```
#define btAssign128(r0,r1,r2,r3) (__m128){static_cast<float>(r0),static_cast<float>(r1),static_cast<float>(r2),static_cast<float>(r3)}
```

I feel like this is a time bomb that's ticking away, though.

Any help would be appreciated. Please ask if you need more information.

**EDIT:** Adding `Wno-narrowing` and/or `Wno-error=narrowing` to `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS` did not help with the issue.

data.title: Prefabs support (level 2)
data.body:
Urho has some prefab support, but for now prefab is just a prototype of object that can be instanciated. This is very limited usage because node don't have any connection to its prefab.
Prefabs are useful for dynamic spawn and useless for scene building because anyway I don't have ability to change all prefab instances in some single place.
I undernstand that this issue can't be easily fixed, but IMO it is quite important.

data.title: Error no OpenGL support in video driver
data.body:
Hi all,

I installed Urho3D on Ubuntu 14.04 32-bit (on VMware on Windows 7) following the instructions here (https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/wiki/G ... d-in-Linux).

After that, I rebooted the system.

Then I tried to run the Ninja example by:
cd /Urho3D/bin
. NinjaSnowWar.sh

But it gives the following error:

[Sat Oct 8 18:31:40 2016] INFO: Opened log file /root/.local/share/urho3d/logs/NinjaSnowWar.as.log
[Sat Oct 8 18:31:40 2016] INFO: Added resource path /home/omid/Urho3D/bin/Data/
[Sat Oct 8 18:31:40 2016] INFO: Added resource path /home/omid/Urho3D/bin/CoreData/
[Sat Oct 8 18:31:40 2016] INFO: Added resource path /home/omid/Urho3D/bin/Autoload/LargeData/
[Sat Oct 8 18:31:40 2016] ERROR: Could not create window, root cause: 'No OpenGL support in video driver'

How can I solve this problem ??

data.title: 64 bit with c++11 option enabled floods output with one warning
data.body:
The warning in question is in line 328 of
Core/Object.h

`EventHandler11Impl(std::function<void(StringHash, VariantMap&)> function, void* userData = 0) :`
`EventHandler((Object*)0xDEADBEEF /* EventHandler insists for receiver_ not being null but it is` `captured in
                                          * function_ already and is not used by EventHandler11Impl */, userData),`

(Object*)0xDEADBEEF causes unsigned int to pointer cast, which causes data loss warning in 64 bit config.
